stories.text: Ideally problems centered around technology or hard sciences, but I wouldn't reject other problem spaces.
stories.title: Ask HN: What are some tough problems that need to be solved?

stories.text:
I am pretty good at it, but I hate all of the products there are to work on and I hate the culture and I hate the isolation. I thought I would like the job because I'm good with the logic and even with style, but it seems like every job available out there exists purely to further late stage capitalism into an ever more absurd farce of utility.

What else can I do out there? I want to be actually useful to my fellow human beings, and I hate pretending that I care at all about company growth or whatever.

Is this entire industry a Bret Easton Ellisonian nightmare?
